title: ⌚️ Apple Watch Compass App (Orientation Based Vibration) [Swift]
description:
Trying to see the possibility of an Apple Watch app that notifies (vibration) the user when they are facing North. That's all. No need for other features. No connection to phone/internet.

It would (I believe) primarily use this feature: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/coremotion/cmmagnetometerdata/1616084-magneticfield

And would use the Apple Watch 5 and Later for magnometer (compass) feature.

MVP: If user's wrist is facing 'north', slightly vibrate for 1s.

Acceptance Criteria
MVP or potential for MVP.
A TestFlight ready app that vibrates for 1s when the user faces North each time.
e.g. I walk and turn east, no vibration
I keep waking and turn north, slight 1s vibration.
I turn west, no vibration.
I turn north again, 1s vibration.

title: GPT3 AI Story Video Generator
description:
I would like to create a tool that can create Story Videos based on prompts. It can be a simple command line tool, no need for a website or app.

User inputs story prompt (ex. A story about a girl and a big mountain)
Story is given to GPT-3 API, in a way so that it gives the story text and descriptions of images for the story (to be used by DALLE-2)
Image prompts from GPT-3 output will be fed to DALLE-2 API (or a different image generating AI)
Story is read by Text-To-Speech API (for ex. Azure Cognitive Services)
Audio and Images are combined to create a single video using the https://remotion.dev library.

Basically, the tool should be written in JavaScript, retrieve data from all the required APIs, and use the Remotion library to create a video from these outputs.

I am a coder myself who has used all these API's and libraries before, and I can provide support if you need any help.

Workflowy.com pioneered an infinitely nestable outline interface which is conducive to this type of task subdivision. This bounty is to create a prototype app which improves upon Workflowy by using a LLM to assist in task subdivision.

Acceptance Criteria

 A function which automatically creates nested subtasks for any given task by using an LLM, such as GPT3

title: Create a podcast webapp that plays podcasts at 0.25x speed
description:
Sometimes you have 100 hours of free time, but only 25 hours of podcasts to listen to. Instead of listening to your favorite podcasts 4 times each, why not listen once at 0.25x speed?

Acceptance Criteria
An easy-to-use webapp that lets the user submit their own podcast, and listen back at 0.25x speed.
Users can submit podcasts in any way that's easy-to-use, such as via Apple podcast link (e.g.https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/season-2-ep-1-the-cursed-production-of-cyber-cowboys/id1561306479?i=1000578054491)
Users should be able to play, pause, rewind 10 seconds, fast-forward 10 seconds, and scrub through the podcast.
It would be super cool if you can adjust the playback speed, but it's not really necessary. Another idea-- it would be really awesome if the playback speed slowly oscillated from 0.25x speed to 0.35x speed, and back and forth. Maybe you would get a really slow Doppler effect?
In designing the web app, feel free to use as many CSS3 transforms and an...
author: dean-yim

title: Implement Google Vision API in React app to grab text from an image
description:
I need help implementing Google Vision's API in my React App. I have a feature that I want to use where a student can take a picture of a problem from their computer or somewhere, and the Google Vision API transcribes it into machine-readable text (called OCR). This will then paste the message into a textbox.

I already have Google Cloud set up. I just need someone to implement this functionality within 1 or 2 days.

We already have the upload image functionality working. Just need the API call to work.

Acceptance Criteria
Google Vision API functionality works in React App (I can take a picture of questions, and it will transcribe it into text in a textbox)
author: SamuelSmith68

title: AI Conversation Assistant
description:
I want to create an app where a user can upload a photo conversation (messages, WhatsApp, Facebook message conversation) and the app determines the best response. First up should be three recommended responses and then there should be an area to select other responses that are based on tone (2) funny (3) witty (4) stern (5) serious.  Also easy ability for me to edit these tones down the line.

Additional functionality is someone can talk back and say I want something more serious / funnier. To teach the ai about the context so the ai can prepare the best message.

The goal is for people who struggle with flirting and conversation (i.e. anxiety of what to say) and acts as an assisting helping with a response or response prompts. The responses should be based off the semantics of the previous conversation and to try to fit the tone of the conversation and not sound like a robot. Ideally using an AI partner (maybe chatGPT or better solution) that is most trained in con...

title: [Swift] ⌚️ Apple Watch UI updates - Small WatchOS App
description:
Looking for some UI and functionality updates for a WatchOS application.
Currently functional here. Repl: https://replit.com/@Bandos1000/FaceNorthWatchOS#CompassHeading.swift

Original bounty here:
https://replit.com/bounties/@Bandos1000/apple-watch-compass?t=details

I am looking for updates to add some functionality after testing. I have Xcode and will be able to test/run this on my developer account after bounty is delivered.

Big picture:
Need to make sure Magnometer continues providing data even if watch screen is off. (But not during sleep/theatre mode)

Application:
The goal of this app is to train users over time to be able to 'feel' North without a wrist vibration.
As such, the user journey looks like this:
User opens app. Each time they open, they are presented with simple options screen: (Screen1)
Option 1: Train me to 'feel' North (Always on)
Option 2: Tell me when I'm facing North for the next 4 hours.
Option 3: Tell me when I'm facing North for the nex...

title: Adjusting original calibration of power meter
description:
To adjust the power readings of a cycling power meter we need a tool to adjust the factory calibration. This could be done with Bluetooth. When adjusting the original calibration the power readings can be adjusted to higher or lower.

Acceptance Criteria

title: Small improvements to Next.js / Tailwind web app
description:
We'd need a couple small changes to a super simple web app, built with Next.js and Tailwind, with a MongoDB database (The Loom vid should give you a pretty good idea - pages are literally just login + sign up + cancel sub + app main).

What the app does, is that it sends a fixed prompt + customer text to OpenAI davinci-003, and gets back the result, and then displays it to our customer.

Changes/additions:
-A simple footer with copyright info and two links
-A header with a "Home" button and perhaps a logo there too
-Add logo above sign up and login text
-Change Stripe integration to include taxes (https://stripe.com/en-fi/tax)
-add some text to pricing plans
-change pricing from subscription to one-time fee
-add three buttons in the UI that change the prompt. The buttons will be visible to the customer, but the prompt will not. If the original prompt is "make it pop", and one of the buttons is pressed, the prompt we use then would be "make it pop" + anything we stored behind the button...

Get started guide which demonstrates how to use the playground.

title: Use GPT to find the concept of the problem, look up an a framework for solving
description:
I'd like to run a bot that takes a sentence describing a problem or issue, uses GPT to help understand the concept being described, and then provides as a response the most appropriate element of a database of pre-approved text responses from a Google Sheet. For example, it could respond with a relevant quote, life lesson, framework for solving the problem, etc.

Acceptance Criteria:
A discord bot or webpage that takes as an input this text string, and provides back the most appropriate item in a list of other pre-set text strings (e.g., frameworks) in the form of a Google Sheet. The creator can make their own sample pre-set data set if they like, to illustrate how it works. I'd also like to understand how the creator used GPT-3. (This may require embeddings or some other fine tuning.)

title: “Link in Bio” React Native App
description:
I want to make a mobile app to connect my friends and I automatically on all social media platforms.

I want to be able to connect to a friend on this app, and automatically follow on instagram, twitter, TikTok… etc. The friend would also follow me on those social medias after connecting on this app.

In order to invite people to connect on this app, a code is required.

Acceptance Criteria
• Create an account on the app
• Connect with Instagram
• Invite Friends with a expiring code
• Automatically follow/connect on the app & instagram
• Browse my connections list
author: Accomplice

title: Custom Tip Chrome Extension
description:
I want to easily be able to tip custom cycles on any repl without having to go to another website or repl.

Acceptance Criteria
You must be able to create a google chrome browser extension that creates an input and button that fits in with the UI (preferably works with themes) and allows you to tip a custom amount of cycles. I also would like the extension code to be clean and organized (preferably commented). The extension can use jQuery but anything else is prohibited.
author: goblinjuice

title: Calendar of Aeroplan Business Class Award Availability from LAX
description:
Create a website with a calendar view of standard business and first-class award availability from LAX to major international destinations outside of North America via scraping Air Canada's Aeroplan website.

One should be able to select the month of Feb 2023 and hover over the date Feb 10th and have a dropdown menu of all destinations with bookable business and first-class awards at standard award chart prices.

Finding availability requires going to https://www.aircanada.com/ca/en/aco/home.html and selecting the "book with aeroplan points" box, entering LAX as the origin and some other major city like Singapore as the destination for a date and searching.

For example, if we search LAX to SIN on Feb 10, 2023, we find a flight listed as 87.5k points for business class that departs at 11:00, has 1 stop, takes 25hr55m, and arrives at 04:55 2 days later. But this flight is actually a mixed cabin award that is mostly in economy class so it doesn't count.
We also see other business class f...
author: GamblingGlobeTrotter

title: Point of Interest Website integrated with ChatGPT
description:
We are looking to build an interactive travel site enabled by ChatGPT.

The website should include a home page with an interactive map and search functionality. Content on the website will be tied to specific locations on the map (we have already written the content). Pinpoints on the map will preview the point of interest, and then users can click to view separate pages on the website which will include the provided content. Each individual content page should include an integration with ChatGPT that users can ask questions to. There should be an open text box (very similar to the ChatGPT playground) for users to type in a prompt and for ChatGPT to respond.
